FOV
Value: the distance (in cm or mm) over which an MR image is acquired or displayed.

Subject: phase FOV
Value:
a parameter that can be selected by a technologist as a percent of our overall field of view.

A different field of view (the scanned region) in the frequency and phase encoding directions that means the data acquisition with fewer measurement lines.

Subject: MRI machine
Value: an image creation device that creates MR images

Subject: MRI imaging assay
Value: an assay that produces MR data about an evaluant

Subject: MRI machine setting datum
Value: the setting datum of an MRI machine

Subject: MR imaging datum
Value: a measurement datum produced by an MRI machine prior to transformation

Subject: MR imaging data transformation
Value: a planned process that produces MR images from MR imaging datum

Subject: MR pulse sequence
Value: the MRI machine setting datum about the radiofrequency pulse sequence

Subject: 1.5T MRI machine
Value: an MRI machine whose primary magnet has 1.5T of strength

Subject: 3T MRI machine
Value: an MRI machine whose primary magnet has 3T of strength

Subject: MR image objective
Value: an objective specification to determine a specified type of information about an entity evaluated by MR imaging

Subject: cerebral microbleed assessment
Value: an MR image objective to determine the presence of extravasated blood in the brain of an evaluant

Subject: lesion quantification
Value: quantification to determine the number and size of lesions in an evaluant

Subject: volumetry
Value: an MR image objective to determine the volume of brain regions in an evaluant

Subject: whole brain volumetry
Value: volumetry to determine the volume of the whole brain of an evaluant

Subject: structural volumetry
Value: volumetry to determine the structure of brain regions in an evaluant

Subject: black hole identification
Value: an MR image objective to determine the presence of hypointense regions that normally appear as white matter on T1 image in an evaluant

Subject: quantitative perfusion analysis
Value: quantification to determine the flow blood through the circulatory system of an evaluant

Subject: calculation of macromolecular ratio
Value: quantification to determine the ratio of carbon, oxygen and hydrogen atoms in macromolecules in an evaluant

Subject: diffusion quantification
Value: quantification to determine the spread of molecules within an evaluant

Subject: tractography
Value: an MR image objective to determine the 3D model of nerve tract data from diffusion images in an evaluant

Subject: iron quantification
Value: quantification to determine the iron content in an evaluant

Subject: functional connectivity
Value: a functional assessment to determine the connectivity of regions of the brain in an evaluant

Subject: functional mapping
Value: a functional assessment to determine the mapping of brain activity in an evaluant

Subject: functional assessment
Value: an MR image assessment to determine brain activity by detecting changes associated with blood flow in an evaluant

Subject: quantification
Value: an MR image objective to determine the specified quantity of a substance in an evaluant

Subject: NeuroSTREAM analysis
Value: we set out to develop and validate an LVV quantification tool for this purpose. Our goal was not to produce a method more precise or accurate than those described above. Rather, we sought to produce a highly robust technique capable of operating on clinical-quality T2-FLAIR images and producing results similar to more established techniques run on high-resolution scans. To do this, we extended an earlier idea for whole brain analysis proposed by (Baillard et al., 2001), and adapted it to LVV measurement on T2-FLAIR images. The core of our approach is a combination of multi-atlas segmentation and level-set refinement. We also extended the cross-sectional method for direct longitudinal analysis by including an optional Jacobian integration step. We called the resulting algorithm “Neurological Software Tool for Reliable Atrophy Measurement” - NeuroSTREAM.
